page.title: 12RELIGION:A GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: {Talland Church.} This is the oldest Christian site in our study block.Its name comes from Cornish and may mean "Brow church", "Tal" means brow and "Lan" is a holy place where Celtic monks preached.The church is built on the side of a hill.There are three Early English windows from the 13th century,most of the church is 15th century.There is a carved slate coffin of a family called Bevill.The tower is separate from the church.It has six bells.In the church there is an inscription in the Cornish language.It says:"Benygys yu a-gar Dew dres pup tra us y'n bys".This means "Blessed is he who loves God beyond anything there is in the world". In the graveyard,there is a headstone of a smuggler called Robert Mark who was shot by Revenue men in 1802. {(cont. on P.13)
